title: Ole Miss rises to sixth in latest CFP rankings
content: Despite former coach Lane Kiffin's departure to LSU over the weekend, 11-1 Ole Miss was not penalized by the College Football Playoff selection committee Tuesday, as the Rebels actually moved up to No. 6 following their 38-19 win at Mississippi State.

title: Sources: No. 1 recruit to hold off on LSU signing
content: LSU pledge Lamar Brown, ESPN's No. 1 overall prospect in the 2026 class, is waiting for Lane Kiffin to assemble his staff before signing with the Tigers.

title: Evans' 3 lifts Blue Devils over champion Gators
content: A go-ahead 3-pointer with 19.7 seconds left by Duke sophomore Isaiah Evans sent the No. 4 Blue Devils to a 67-66 win over reigning national champion Florida on Tuesday, an effort that gave them a 9-0 mark, including five wins at Cameron Indoor Stadium.

title: Sitake gets new deal with BYU amid PSU interest
content: Kalani Sitake will remain at BYU, with the sides agreeing to a long-term extension Tuesday amid interest from Penn State in hiring him as its next football coach.

title: LSU's Kiffin to let Weis Jr. coach Ole Miss in CFP
content: LSU assistant Charlie Weis Jr., who is part of new coach Lane Kiffin's staff with the Tigers, will be allowed to return to Ole Miss and serve as offensive coordinator through the College Football Playoff.

title: Vanderbilt flips five-star QB Curtis from Georgia
content: Five-star quarterback Jared Curtis, ESPN's No. 1 pocket passer and the No. 5 overall recruit in the 2026 class, flipped his commitment from Georgia to Vanderbilt on Tuesday, sources told ESPN.

title: Fitzgerald: 'There will be no more motivated coach'
content: Pat Fitzgerald spoke with eight schools about potential coaching jobs, looking for the best place to resume his career, before choosing Michigan State. "It was almost a no-brainer for me when the opportunity was presented," he said Tuesday.

title: Steelers claim veteran WR Thielen, cut CB Slay
content: The Steelers claimed wide receiver Adam Thielen off waivers Tuesday and waived veteran cornerback Darius Slay.

title: Bracketology: Texas moves up to No. 2 overall, but UCLA is the 1-seed to watch
content: The Bruins suffered their first loss and got leapfrogged by Texas. But UCLA has Quad 1 wins and more depth on the way.

title: Ranking the top 25 MLB offseason trade candidates -- and finding their best fits
content: From All-Star outfielders to elite aces, here are the big names your team could be targeting this winter.

title: New NFL Power Rankings: Let's stack the entire league 1-32 -- and pick out late-season X factors
content: See our latest rankings ahead of Week 14. We also picked out X factors for the last five weeks of the regular season.

title: A brawl, a shark attack and an MVP: The final run of The Rooster
content: What was Danilo Gallinari, who earned more than $200M in the NBA, doing in Puerto Rico? Ending a decades-long chase.

title: From bed rest to champion: Chet Holmgren is just getting started
content: Holmgren was sidelined for three months last season because of a fractured pelvis and is "chasing for more" this season.

title: Will Brandon Aiyuk return for the 49ers this season? Answering five top questions
content: San Francisco voided Aiyuk's contract guarantees for next year. What does that mean for 2025 and beyond?

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (19!), Broncos' D (51!)
content: The Browns vet edge rusher and Denver's defense are on pace to rewrite the single-season sacks record book. Here's where things stand.

title: Tracking all the firings and hirings
content: With the college football coaching carousel fully in motion, here's a recap of every FBS vacancy and hiring.

title: How the U23s can boost USWNT options for World Cup 2027
content: Emma Hayes has revitalized the U.S. U23 pathway and a win over England showed how it will help her options ahead of the 2027 World Cup.

title: Even without Aitana Bonmatí, Spain still show why they are best in the world
content: Spain cap off the year winning the UEFA Women's Nations League, cementing their spot as the world's best team.

title: Why Christian Pulisic might be in the midst of his best season as a pro -- and why it might not last
content: The U.S. men's national team star is having a career season in Italy with AC Milan. What has changed for Christian Pulisic?

title: Rankings for Week 14
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Free agents: Kyle Monangai, Bam Knight are essential pickups
content: All the free agent options worth adding heading into Week 14 and the start of the fantasy football playoff season.

title: How to bet the Heisman Trophy race, which comes down to the Big Ten championship game
content: With the race expected to come down to Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza and Ohio State QB Julian Sayin, the Big Ten championship game likely determines who wins the Heisman Trophy.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Athletes Unlimited Softball League: Expansion and allocation draft
content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: Transfer rumors: Man United, Madrid, Barcelona eye Brown
content: Clubs all across Europe are linked with a move for Eintracht Frankfurt left back Nathaniel Brown. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Rs 90 to a dollar: What it means for your EMI, education, and everyday life
content: The Indian rupee has fallen below Rs 90 to the US dollar for the first time, signaling a shift in economic perception and impacting households. This depreciation, driven by trade tensions, investor exodus, and an RBI policy shift, makes imports costlier and affects education and travel expenses for citizens.

title: Delhi MCD bypoll results: BJP wins big with 7 of 12 seats, AAP bags 3; list of winners
content: BJP secured 7 out of 12 seats in the MCD by-elections, retaining its lead but falling short of a majority. AAP won 3 seats, Congress 1, and All India Forward Bloc secured a victory in Chandni Mahal. The results indicate a shift in the political landscape ahead of the mayoral polls.

title: Another technical snag: Microsoft outage delays check-in at airports; flights affected
content: Flight operations faced significant disruptions Wednesday morning as check-in systems at multiple airports simultaneously failed. Airlines, including IndiGo and Air India Express, resorted to manual procedures, leading to flight delays. Passengers were informed of a global Microsoft Windows service outage impacting airport IT systems.

title: Shubman Gill all set to play T20Is vs South Africa
content: Shubman Gill is currently undergoing rehabilitation at the BCCI CoE but is likely to link-up with the T20I squad in Cuttack on December 6.

title: 'Tech’s hidden cost destroying value': Legendary investor Michael Burry warns; blames Musk
content: Legendary investor Michael Burry has slammed Tesla and tech giants for diluting shareholder value through stock-based compensation, arguing it's unfairly excluded from earnings. He highlighted Tesla's 3.6% annual dilution and Elon Musk's massive pay package as prime examples. Burry, known for predicting the 2008 crash, believes these accounting practices mask true costs, urging investors to scrutinize tech valuations.

title: Nifty to cross 29,000 levels! Check top picks for your portfolio by Nomura
content: Nomura forecasts a potential 13% upside for the Nifty in 2026, projecting it to reach 29,300. This optimism stems from improving domestic and global conditions, including calmer geopolitics and stable macros. The brokerage also identified its top stock picks, anticipating a cyclical recovery in economic and corporate earnings growth.

title: Dog remark row: Cong MP’s ‘bhow bhow’ reply to question on privilege motion — watch
content: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury responded to a potential privilege motion for bringing a dog to Parliament with a bark, questioning the outrage over the animal while other pressing issues are ignored. She asserted there's no rule against bringing pets and vowed to continue caring for animals, suggesting the "real dogs" are in Parliament.

title: 'AI won't take your job': AWS CEO draws clear line; remark amid 14,000 Amazon layoffs
content: AWS CEO Matt Garman asserts AI amplifies human skills, not replacing jobs, citing efficiency gains like a codebase rewrite by six people. This comes amid Amazon's significant AI infrastructure investment and workforce reductions, which internal communications linked to AI's transformative power. Over 1,000 employees, however, voiced concerns about AI's impact on democracy, jobs, and climate goals.

title: ‘Lacks moral character’: Indian national jailed in US over mediacare fraud of $1.17M
content: An Indian national, Mohammed Asif, has been sentenced to two years in US federal prison for orchestrating a Medicare fraud scheme. His Everett-based lab, American Labworks LLC, billed over $8 million for unreceived COVID-19 and respiratory tests, defrauding Medicare of more than $1.1 million. Asif, who controlled the lab's finances, will also pay over $1.1 million in restitution.

title: Who is Amar Subramanya, Indian-origin UW PhD leading Apple’s AI efforts?
content: Apple welcomes Indian-origin AI expert Amar Subramanya as VP of AI, reporting to Craig Federighi. Subramanya, with a strong background from Google and Microsoft, will lead Apple Foundation Models, ML research, and AI Safety. This move signifies a new chapter in Apple's AI strategy, focusing on integrating advanced research into user-centric products.

title: Ford CEO warns: We are in deep trouble because the US lacks skilled labour
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical US trade worker shortage, leaving 1 million jobs unfilled. He highlights a dangerous gap compared to China in building essential workforces, impacting national security. Farley advocates for rebuilding the blue-collar pipeline through investment in trade schools and education, emphasizing fair wages and career paths for workers.

title: 'Focus on hard work' — Heavily trolled Harshit Rana knows consistency is his only currency
content: Pacer Harshit Rana dismisses social media criticism, focusing on performance ahead of the third ODI against South Africa. Despite facing trolling and accusations of favoritism, Rana emphasises his dedication to hard work on the field. His recent performance and potential are lauded by captain KL Rahul and former selector Sarandeep Singh.

title: White House shooting: Trump halts immigration applications from 19 nations - check list
content: The Trump administration has halted immigration application processing for individuals from 19 countries, including green card requests. This move, prompted by a recent shooting incident, mandates a comprehensive re-review and potential re-interview of applicants from high-risk nations who entered the US after January 20, 2021. The directive also impacts approved benefit requests for immigrants arriving during the Biden administration.

title: This day in 1971: How IAF hit back after Pak’s pre-emptive strikes — watch rare footage
content: The Indian Air Force commemorated its decisive response to Pakistan's 1971 pre-emptive strikes, which led to a 14-day war and the birth of Bangladesh. IAF's precise counter-attacks crippled enemy airfields, blunting their initial move. This victory, celebrated as Vijay Diwas, contrasts with current strained India-Bangladesh ties, while Pakistan-Bangladesh relations have improved.

title: Saudi Arabia approves $350 billion budget for 2026, focused on vision 2030 goals
content: Saudi Arabia has approved its 2026 state budget of 1.313 trillion riyals ($350 billion), targeting economic growth and Vision 2030 goals. Public revenues are estimated at 1.147 trillion riyals, with a projected deficit of 165 billion riyals. The plan emphasizes fiscal sustainability, development projects, social programs, and giga projects, aiming to strengthen the economy, enhance public services, and support citizens’ well-being.

title: 'Nothing to complain about’: Acquitted in spy case, BrahMos scientist freed after 7 years' jail
content: Sacked BrahMos scientist Nishant Agarwal was released from Nagpur Central Prison after seven years, having been acquitted of charges of leaking classified missile information. A court found the prosecution failed to establish intent to compromise national security, noting his impeccable record and lack of evidence of data transfer.

title: Video: Cong leader’s AI clip of PM selling tea at red-carpet triggers row; BJP hits back
content: Congress spokesperson Ragini Nayak shared an AI-generated video portraying PM Narendra Modi as a "chaiwala" at an international summit, referencing his past. The BJP reacted furiously, accusing the Congress of mocking a "kaamdar" prime minister from a backward community and his humble origins.

title: Exclusive: 'Finisher's role isn't thankless' — Dinesh Karthik calls it a high-skill job
content: Dinesh Karthik is gearing up for a fresh challenge with Sharjah Warriors in ILT20 after playing in the SA20 last year. In this conversation with TimesofIndia.com, the former India cricketer breaks down the contrasting dynamics of both leagues, the evolution of finishers, why Tim David is miles ahead of the pack, and the science behind power-hitting.

title: BJP bags 83% of Rs 915cr routed via Tata Group-controlled trust
content: Political donations via electoral trusts reveal the BJP received a substantial Rs 959 crore in 2024-25, with the Tata group's Progressive Electoral Trust contributing Rs 757.6 crore. While Congress secured over Rs 313 crore through trusts, its overall contributions are significantly lower than bond receipts in previous years. Other parties also received smaller allocations.

title: SIR stress buster: BLO grooves to desi beats with senior officers after achieving targets
content: Amidst nationwide reports of stress on Booth Level Officers (BLOs), a heartwarming scene unfolded in Chomu, Jaipur. Sub-Divisional Officer Dilip Singh Rathore celebrated the constituency's 100% electoral roll enumeration with a lively party. He was seen enthusiastically dancing with BLOs and other officials, marking the successful completion of intensive revision work and acknowledging the team's dedication.

title: K'taka power tussle: Cong's KC Venugopal met with loud ‘DK, DK’ chants at airport — watch
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar showcased unity after a second breakfast meeting, declaring they would govern together. This display follows a directive from the Congress high command to project solidarity ahead of the Belagavi legislature session, aiming to quell internal power tussle.

title: Sarvagya Kushwaha creates history; becomes youngest FIDE-rated chess player
content: Three-year-old Sarvagya Singh Kushwaha from Madhya Pradesh has become the youngest player to earn an official FIDE rating at 1572. He achieved this by defeating three internationally rated opponents, showcasing exceptional talent and discipline. His parents introduced him to chess to limit screen time, leading to his rapid development into a prodigy.

title: Delhi University bomb scare: Threat emails sent to Ramjas, Deshbandhu colleges
content: Ramjas College and Deshbandhu College in Delhi received bomb threat emails on Thursday, prompting an immediate emergency response. Police, bomb disposal squads, and dog squads conducted thorough inspections of both campuses. Students and staff were evacuated to safer areas as a precautionary measure while investigations are underway.

title: Erika Kirk aims to outshine Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce in Charlie Kirk tribute
content: Following Charlie Kirk's assassination, his widow Erika launched a grand public tribute, aiming for a scale rivaling Taylor Swift's Eras Tour.  She declared her husband's remembrance would be a global spectacle, asserting his legacy deserved immense prominence and emotional power. This ambition transformed personal loss into a movement of remembrance.

title: Auston Matthews’ captaincy questioned as ex-GM says Leafs chose wrong captain
content: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.

title: Mike Tyson reveals $40k monthly cannabis habit, says family urged him to restart
content: Mike Tyson revealed on a podcast that his family urged him to resume smoking cannabis after a brief five-day break, as his intense, unmedicated demeanor frightened them.  He explained that marijuana helps him manage his mood, maintain calm, and feel more like himself, contrasting it with the negative effects of alcohol.

title: Can Ozempic cause depression or suicidal thoughts? Australia’s new findings
content: The EMA (European Medicines Agency), FDA and WHO identified semaglutide suicidal thought reports, exceeding those of other diabetes medications in their adverse event databases. The TGA Advisory Committee on Medicines (ACM) evaluated the data

title: '13-year-old pulled the trigger': 80k watched Afghan man's public execution
content: A 13-year-old boy reportedly pulled the trigger in the public execution of a man accused of murdering his family members in Afghanistan's Khost province. Tens of thousands witnessed the event, where Taliban officials placed a weapon in the boy's hands after he refused to pardon the convicted man.

title: 'No archival evidence': Congress slams Rajnath's 'Nehru wanted to rebuild Babri' charge
content: Congress has vehemently refuted Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's assertion that Jawaharlal Nehru intended to fund the Babri Masjid's construction with public money, a claim the party labels a "lie." Citing Nehru's opposition to state funding for religious sites, including the Somnath Temple, Congress stated they would not permit the distortion of Nehru and Sardar Patel's legacies by "Godse's followers."

title: Smriti Mandhana's new wedding date: Brother breaks silence – truth behind the buzz
content: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal's wedding, postponed due to a medical emergency, has fueled speculation about a new date. Smriti's brother, Shravan Mandhana, has denied rumours of a December 7th ceremony, stating the wedding remains postponed with no new date finalised yet. Families are still recovering from the emotional shock.

title: Meesho IPO opens today: Should you subscribe? Check price band, GMP, outlook & more
content: Meesho's IPO opens Wednesday, aiming for Rs 5,421 crore with a strong grey market premium, driven by positive analyst views. The e-commerce platform, backed by SoftBank, secured significant anchor investor interest, oversubscribing by nearly 30 times. Funds will fuel cloud infrastructure, marketing, and acquisitions, positioning Meesho for a December 10 debut.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where are gold, silver headed in December? Check outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised for a positive month, despite expected volatility, according to market experts. Silver has surged due to global shortages and strong rate cut expectations, outperforming gold. Central bank demand for gold remains robust, while upcoming US economic data and Fed decisions will be key for market direction.

title: ‘Did what humans didn’t’: Abandoned newborn survives night guarded by stray dogs
content: In Nabadwip, stray dogs formed a protective ring around an abandoned newborn outside a toilet, guarding the infant through the night. A local woman discovered the baby at dawn and arranged for his hospital transfer. Police are investigating the abandonment, with the child welfare committee to ensure his long-term care.

title: Oregon: Indian man charged with homicide after crash kills two — what probe revealed
content: An Indian national, Rajinder Kumar, faces homicide charges after his semi-truck crashed in Oregon, killing two. The Department of Homeland Security identified Kumar as an illegal immigrant released under the Biden administration, raising concerns about undocumented drivers operating commercial vehicles. This incident follows a pattern of similar fatal crashes involving Indian truck drivers.

title: 'Aim to elevate India-Russia ties': Putin ahead of upcoming Modi meet - what's on agenda
content: President Putin is set to visit India, aiming to elevate cooperation with New Delhi and Beijing to a new level, particularly in technology. Discussions will focus on joint projects in energy, industry, and space, alongside increasing Indian goods imports. Defense deals, including S-400 missiles and Su-57 fighters, alongside nuclear energy cooperation, are also on the agenda.

title: '24x7 open door & hookah hangouts' - ex-CSK star reveals Dhoni's unique bonding culture
content: Former CSK star Mike Hussey revealed MS Dhoni's room served as an unofficial team lounge, fostering off-field bonding through open hospitality and shisha sessions. This culture, also highlighted by George Bailey, created a strong sense of belonging within the franchise.  Hussey also noted Dhoni's unusual lack of wicketkeeping practice, contrasting with his extensive batting sessions.

title: Donald's 'sleepy Joe' moment: Trump struggles to stay awake at Cabinet meeting - watch
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom shared a video of President Trump appearing to nod off during a cabinet meeting, with eyes narrowed and shut while officials briefed him. The White House denied the claims, stating Trump listened attentively throughout the three-hour meeting. This incident follows past reports and Trump's own criticisms of Joe Biden's stamina.

title: 'You are missing something in life': K'taka CM to 'pure' vegetarian reporter
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's comment to a female reporter that she was "missing something in life" for being a strict vegetarian has garnered attention. The remark was made during a breakfast meeting with Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar, where their differing food preferences were highlighted.

title: No deal after 5 hours: Trump envoys' meeting with Putin went past midnight
content: Kremlin reports no peace deal progress after five-hour talks between President Putin and Trump envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner. While some US proposals were reviewed, Russia expressed criticism on several points. Discussions touched on territorial claims, but significant work remains for both Moscow and Washington. Putin conveyed greetings to Trump, with contacts to continue.

title: YouTuber Rahul Easwar remanded to police custody amid support for rape accused MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Rahul Easwar had declared a hunger strike in prison and reiterated that he would continue to support Rahul  Mamkootathil. Court orders prison authorities to ensure Rahul Easwar received medical attention

title: New Bihar Government committed to creation of 1 crore jobs in next 5 years: Governor
content: Bihar Governor Arif Mohammad Khan also made a mention of the Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana, launched a month ahead of the announcement of assembly polls, which has been credited for tilting the scales in favour of the NDA

title: Doctor to be sentenced for selling Matthew Perry ketamine before ’Friends’ star’s overdose death
content: Prosecutors are asking U.S. District Judge Sherilyn Peace Garnett to sentence Dr. Plasencia, 44, to three years in prison after a plea agreement where the doctor admitted to illegally selling Perry large amounts of ketamine

title: BLO on SIR duty attempts to end life in Meerut; family alleges harassment by supervisor
content: Family members claimed Mohit Chaudhary had been under severe stress for several days due to dual responsibilities and a heavy workload

title: Muzaffarnagar police remove over 55 loudspeakers from mosques in drive against noise violations
content: According to police, the loudspeakers were taken down from mosques located in the Civil Lines, Kotwali and Khalapar police station areas as part of the enforcement campaign

title: Parliament Winter session: Rajya Sabha witnesses war of words over renaming of Raj Bhavans, expunging of remarks
content: The discussion took a contentious turn when AITC member Dola Sen raised additional issues, including MGNREGA, prompting the Chair to state that the deviated remarks would not go on record

title: Spam calls: DoT to mandate display of KYC-registered names on incoming calls
content: The feature, known as Caller Name Presentation, will use the same technology that telecom operators use to flag certain calls as “Suspected” or “Suspicious”

title: Begin by fixing system, clean air will follow: Kiran Bedi pitches five reforms for pollution fight
content: The former IPS officer said that the CAQM is led by a retired official who, while experienced, lack the administrative leverage and political heft essential to move ministries and influence budgets

title: After SC intervention, Centre agrees to return pregnant woman, child deported to Bangladesh
content: The Centre assured the Supreme Court that the woman would be provided free care and the necessary facilities, taking into consideration her medical condition

title: Modi-Trump ‘huglomacy’ in deep freeze, says Congress as Rubio repeats Trump’s claims of brokering India-Pakistan ceasefire
content: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that Mr. Trump has brokered several peace deals, including the very dzangerous ones like India and Pakistan, and deserves tremendous credit for reshaping America’s foreign policy

title: Cough syrup case: Fourth man arrested from Lucknow for illegal storage, trade of banned drug
content: The informants revealed that these drugs were being sent to other parts of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Bihar, Jharkhand, Assam, West Bengal and Bangladesh

title: Cultural performance attract thousands of tourists at Hornbill Festival in Nagaland
content: Co-organiser M. Ababe Ezung announced that the 2025 edition features 97 photographers from across Nagaland

title: Soldier dies in Rajasthan after Army tank sinks in Indira Gandhi canal
content: A routine training exercise in which the armoured vehicles were practising to cross the canal was under way when the tank got stuck in the middle and started sinking, said the police

title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee unveils report card of her government’s performance for past 14 years
content: Among the major announcements, which the Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee made, included that 1.72 crore people have been lifted out of poverty between 2013 and 2023 reduced by 40%

title: Cyclone Ditwah impact: India sends mobile field hospital, over 70 medical personnel to Sri Lanka
content: Emergency medical aid from India, including field hospitals, medicines, equipment and medical personnel, landed in Sri Lanka on Tuesday (December 2, 2025), the Sri Lankan President’s office said; death toll in Sri Lanka reached 474 on Wednesday (December 3, 2025), according to the latest figures

title: Students, security staff clash at U.P.’s BHU after vehicle hits female student
content: Assistant Police Commissioner Gaurav Kumar on Wednesday said the situation is now fully under control, and no written complaint has been filed by either side so far

title: Navi Mumbai reports 499 child kidnappings in 11 months; 41 still missing
content: The police registered 483 cases of these child kidnappings and solved 442 of them, achieving a detection rate of 91.78% as per the data

title: Heavy vehicles not to be permitted on Thirumukkudal bridge during peak hours
content: The bridge in Kancheepuram district is notorious for accidents caused by heavy vehicles from nearby stone quarries

title: Watch: Putin issues stark warning to Europe amid Ukraine tensions
content: President Vladimir Putin warned Europe that Russia is ready for war if attacked, saying any conflict would end decisively. He criticised European powers for blocking Ukraine peace efforts, called Russia’s actions ‘surgical,’ and dismissed claims that Russia could target NATO. The remarks come ahead of talks with U.S. envoys.

title: Delhi riots case hearing LIVE updates: SC to resume hearing rejoinder submissions on behalf of Umar Khalid, other accused
content: The three activists told the Supreme Court on Tuesday (December 2, 2025) that the Delhi Police’s claim of a coordinated “regime change operation” behind the 2020 Delhi riots finds no mention in the chargesheet

title: German delegation applauds KSRTC’s inclusive mobility innovations in Bengaluru
content: Among other things, the team experienced Dhwani Spandana–OnBoard, an assistive audio-navigation system that enhances bus accessibility for visually impaired commuters

title: Parliament Winter session Day 3 LIVE: Lok Sabha MPs question Centre on combating fake news on TV and social media
content: Both Houses take up business after Centre agrees to a discussion on the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) as demanded by Opposition

title: Kerala local body polls: A litmus test for LDF governance, UDF revival in Ernakulam
content: Both UDF and LDF is vying for political dominance in this traditionally Congress stronghold. While the UDF seeks to reclaim the crucial Kochi Corporation after its loss in 2020, the LDF aims to validate its governance amidst rising anti-incumbency sentiments.

title: Kerala local body polls: Edamalakkudy keeps a list of grievances ready for the election winner
content: The first tribal panchayat in the State, formed in 2010, is yet to have a proper road and residents have to walk hours to reach another settlement or health centres. Most hamlets lack electricity supply.

title: Why the SIR needs to be completely digitised
content: The Election Commission is facing criticism for its Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls as reliance on outdated data threatens voter inclusion and the integrity of upcoming elections

title: Kerala local body elections 2025: UDF pushes for political reset in State
content: UDF leadership feels that its political identity as a cohesive coalition is at stake in the local body polls, a precursor to the Assembly elections. It seeks to negate LDF campaign that the Opposition is a shaky coalition built on protest against development rather than one capable of exercising power effectively

title: Russia parliament ratifies key pact on military, logistic support with India ahead of Putin’s state visit
content: Russian Cabinet of Ministers stated that ratification will facilitate mutual use of the two countries' airspace and port calls by Russian and Indian warships

title: Police, criminal courts must be careful in filing chargesheet, framing charges in civil disputes: SC
content: The court said the tendency of filing chargesheets in matters where no strong suspicion is made out clogs the judicial system

title: The long struggle to remove a British military officer’s statue from Chennai’s Mount Road
content: The issue even reached the British Parliament where citizens of the western country suggested that the statue of James George Smith Neil be sent to London.

title: How the Kosi’s shifting course exposes the perils of embankments
content: Do concrete embankments protect against floods from rivers such as Kosi or are their very walls making the plains more vulnerable?

title: Vacancies in loco pilot posts cause hardship to commuters in Chennai division
content: The Chennai division of Southern Railway which operates hundreds of suburban, mail and express trains has been mainly facing shortage of loco pilots.

title: How old debt defaults came to haunt an ex-Minister in a corruption case many years later
content: In 1973, K. Ponnusamy was working as a Lecturer at a Government Arts College in Tamil Nadu, he availed of a ₹13,000 crop loan from the Bank of India but failed to repay the loan. The bank moved the court and collected the amount

title: Peru presidential hopeful bloodied but safe after gun attack
content: Gunmen on a motorbike fired several shots at the SUV the 50-year-old politician, Rafael Belaunde was driving

title: India trashes Pakistan's claim of denial of overflight to send aid to Sri Lanka
content: The request for overflight clearance for a Pakistani aircraft carrying humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka was received by the Indian high commission in Islamabad at around 1 p.m. on December 1, Randhir Jaiswal said

title: People should disclose details as per Census Act: Home Ministry
content: Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai’s reply comes in response to a Trinamool MP’s query on disclosure of caste

title: J&K government submits proposal to relax age requirements for jobs to L-G
content: According to job aspirants, the past six years have seen the cancellation of many selection lists and many lists faced legal challenges

title: Over 90 laws still discriminate against people with leprosy, NHRC tells Supreme Court
content: The top court was hearing a batch of petitions contending that such statutory provisions discriminate against persons affected by leprosy in ways that entrench stigma and undermine their dignity

title: ‘Waiting for her to walk through the door’: father of woman pushed into Bangladesh
content: Bhodu Sheikh has been fighting for the return of his daughter’s family since they, along with another family — Sweety Bibi , her husband and their two children — were pushed across the border on June 27 after being picked up by the Delhi Police on June 18 on charges of being illegal Bangladeshi citizens.

title: Three injured as wall collapses on makeshift eatery in Chennai’s Dashamakan
content: Fire and rescue service personnel and Purasawalkam Tahsildar Kuppammal Ramu were at the site soon after the incident

title: Soldier Dies After Army Tank Sinks In Rajasthan's Indira Gandhi Canal
content: An Army soldier was killed during a routine military exercise in the Indira Gandhi canal in Rajasthan's Sriganganagar district, police said on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Sanchar Saathi Mess: 5 Lessons From The Centre's Spectacular Misfire
content: It's worrying that nobody in authority had the brains to anticipate the outrage that has dominated the public discourse in the last two days. In a way, the government has brought this blowback upon itself.

title: "Woof Woof": Congress' Renuka Chowdhary 'Barks' In Bite On Dog Row
content: Congress MP and former Union Minister Renuka Chowdhury, who made headlines for bringing a dog to Parliament and then taking potshots at fellow lawmakers, was defiant this morning

title: Putin's India Visit To Test New Delhi's US-Russia Balancing Act
content: On the eve of his visit, Putin hailed his country's ties with India and China, and pledged to boost relations to a "qualitatively new level."

title: What Happened To MH370? New Search Starts Soon, Seeks To End Mystery
content: Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 with 239 people on board disappeared nearly 12 years ago and still remains one of the world's greatest aviation mysteries.

title: Railway Constable Shot Dead By Colleague In Chhattisgarh, Motive Unclear
content: The victim, Head Constable PK Mishra, was on duty when he was allegedly shot four times by fellow RPF head constable KS Lader.

title: Costco Becomes Latest Top Firm To Demand Refund On Trump's Taxes
content: Costco is joining other companies that aren't waiting to see whether the Supreme Court strikes down President Donald Trump's most sweeping import taxes. They're going to court to demand refunds on the tariffs they've paid.

title: 32-Year-Old Indian Man Charged With Homicide In Fatal Truck Crash In US
content: An Indian man who entered the US illegally three years ago has been charged with homicide after two persons were killed when a semi-truck he was driving collided with their car.

title: "Incorrect": Jagan Reddy's Party Refutes Charges On His Air Travel
content: YSRCP also countered the TDP and demanded the release of a full record of air travel expenses incurred during former Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu's tenure.

title: "Islamic Conservatist Asim Munir Yearns For War With India": Imran Khan's Sister
content: Asim Munir's Islamic radicalisation and conservatism force him to fight against those who don't believe in Islam, said Imran Khan's sister, Aleema Khan.

title: Telangana Class 10 Student Beaten With Sticks, Bats By Seniors In Hostel Room
content: The incident, which occurred late on Saturday night, was reportedly concealed by the school administration and surfaced after a video of the attack circulated on social media.

title: Madhya Pradesh Government Spending Rs 21 Lakh On Air Travel Daily, Shows Data
content: According to the report tabled in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly, the state spent Rs 290 crore on aircraft rentals between January 2021 and November 2025.

title: Sanchar Saathi App Downloads Jump 10 Times On Tuesday, Claims DoT
content: The government's cyber security and safety app Sanchar Saathi recorded a 10-fold jump in downloads on Tuesday, rising from a daily average of around 60,000 to nearly 6 lakh, DoT sources said on Wednesday.

title: MCD By-Election Result Live: BJP Wins 7, AAP 3, Congress, Left Gain 1 Each
content: Delhi MCD By-election Result LIVE Updates: BJP won seven of the 12 wards in Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) today.

title: US Pauses Immigration Applications From 19 Non-European Countries
content: The Trump administration on Tuesday said it paused all immigration applications, including green card and U.S. citizenship processing, filed by immigrants from 19 non-European countries, citing concerns over national security and public safety.

title: With 'Trump Accounts,' Your Baby Could Qualify For $1,000. All About It
content: Under "Trump Accounts," every newborn gets $1,000, which is invested in the stock market by private firms, and the child can access the funds when they turn 18.

title: Dell Founder, Wife Pledge $6.25 Billion To 'Trump Accounts' For Children
content: The Dell donation will fund $250 deposits in saving accounts for at least 25 million children aged 10 and under, who were born before the cut-off point for the original program.

title: Rupee Falls To Record Low, Crosses 90 Against The Dollar For First Time
content: The Indian rupee fell sharply on Wednesday, slipping past the crucial 90-per-dollar level for the first time ever.

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 3 Live Updates: Proceedings Begin In Lok Sabha And Rajya Sabha
content: On the third day of the Parliament's Winter Session, the government is set to resume key legislative business in the Lok Sabha, with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman likely to move the Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025.

title: Bengaluru police book unknown person for hoax email to Kempegowda International Airport, shopping malls
content: The Bengaluru police received a mail on their official address threatening to carry out a series of bomb blasts at Kempegowda International Airport and several major shopping malls in the city, which after verification was termed as a hoax

title: Flight disruptions at  Kempegowda International Airport due to technical and operational reasons
content: There were flight disruptions at the Kempegowda International Airport on Tuesday owing to technical and operational reasons

title: Karnataka High Court finds no procedural lapses in extending time to submit chargesheet in murder case in which MLA Basavaraj is accused
content: The provisions of the Karnataka Control of Organized Crime Act (KCOCA) has been invoked against all the accused

title: Experts push for integrative approach to obesity, metabolic disorders at Ayurveda meet
content: As metabolic diseases surge worldwide, experts called for stronger evidence-based integration of Ayurveda with modern medicine at a two-day international conference on Ayurveda and Integrative Approaches to Obesity and Metabolic Syndrome

title: ‘Unacceptable’, say MEA officials after envoys of U.K., France and Germany author anti-Putin article
content: The article blamed Russia for the war in Ukraine and accused Putin of “total disregard for human life”

title: Farmer, two sons electrocuted after stepping on illegal electrical fence in Vellore
content: As they were checking different plant species at various spots in the nursery, Janakiraman accidentally stepped on a snapped live electric wire in the farm nursery.

title: Two persons killed in road accident near Ambur on Chennai - Bengaluru Highway
content: Police said that along with his mother in-law, Divyaman and his wife were on their way to Vellore in their car when Lovely, who was driving the vehicle, reportedly lost control of the vehicle and hit a parked lorry on the stretch.

title: Five Kargil councillors move J&K HC against Ladakh L-G order which nominated a Muslim to the council
content: ‘The seat is reserved for a member of the “principle religious minority” from the region and Buddhists, not Muslims, are the largest minority group in Kargil.’

title: Define 'fake news', amend penal provisions to take action: Parliamentary panel
content: "There is also a need to amend the penal provisions for publishing/telecasting fake news in relevant Acts/Rules/Guidelines for each form of media (print, electronic, digital),"says Parliamentary Standing Committee

title: J&K Deputy CM moves Delhi HC for removal of objectionable content against him on social media
content: Surinder Kumar Choudhary has claimed that there is alleged defamatory content with sexual undertones on several social media platforms, including Facebook and YouTube channels, against him

title: Defence Minster says 130th Constitutional Amendment will be part of Patel’s legacy
content: Bill mandates that any public officeholder required to remain in jail for more than 30 days must resign

title: J&K High Court allows PDP MLA Waheed Parra to travel outside Union Territory
content: Court modifies bail conditions for PDP legislator facing UAPA case, permits domestic travel with prior intimation

title: India-Maldives joint military exercise begins in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The exercise will include tactical drills, joint mission planning and exchange of best practices, aimed at improving coordinated responses to shared security challenges

title: Delhi riots case: No ‘regime change’ claim in charge sheet, activists tell Supreme Court
content: The Delhi Police’s claim of a coordinated ‘regime change operation’ behind the February 2020 Delhi riots finds no mention in the chargesheet, even though it was now being projected as a central plank of the prosecution’s case, the petitioners said

title: West Bengal announces compensation linked to SIR-related distress
content: “39 deaths and several illness cases have been reported amid stress surrounding the Special Intensive Revision process,” says Mamata Banerjee

title: ‘India should focus on building national aircraft’
content: Aequs invests ₹600 crore in consumer electronics plant in Hubballi to manufacture portable computer parts, smart devices and multipurpose wearables

title: Assam Congress chief seeks PM’s intervention in Tezpur University unrest
content: Gaurav Gogoi flags allegations of mismanagement, administrative lapses and financial irregularities as Central varsity remains shut

title: Political interests are creating linguistic divisions, says Education Minister
content: ‘We firmly believe that multi-lingualism is our strength and not a liability,’ Dharmendra Pradhan said at the inauguration of the fourth edition of the Kashi Tamil Sangamam

title: Rajya Sabha proceedings disrupted as Opposition parties continue protest
content: It “may not be appropriate” to hold a debate on “electoral reforms” before a discussion on 150 years of the Vande Mataram, says Kiren Rijiju; RS Chair rejects 20 Opposition notices for discussions under Rule 267

title: Kuki body asks NHRC to reject Manipur govt. action taken reports denying State complicity
content: In the reports, the Manipur government has said that allegations that the State ‘chooses to support and assist’ militants/terrorist groups of the dominant community were ‘wrong and misconceived’

title: RSS’s farmers’ body asks Centre to ban land pooling, seeks uniform land acquisition law
content: ‘Concerned about the lack of attention to the interests of villages and farmers affected by the acquisition of agricultural land across the country’

title: DRDO conducts successful high speed test of indigenous fighter escape system
content: Rocket sled trial in Chandigarh validates canopy severance, ejection sequencing and aircrew recovery for Light Combat Aircraft escape system

title: ED notice in masala bond a result of CPI(M)-BJP nexus, alleges Adoor Prakash
content: UDF convener says LDF long practised voter fraud and that the Sabarimala gold heist probe being sabotaged

title: Drop list: It's time to move on from these four players
content: some of the biggest movers from the Oct. 31 fantasy rankings to last week's update . some of these "difference-makers" have made exactly one difference: sinking your team . "i'm not mad ... just disappointed," ranked 129 on Oct. 31, 270 last week .

title: How USC landed the No. 1 class and relaunched a recruiting powerhouse
